author: Glenn Garner
title: Lil Nas X Trolls Critics With Website About Being Saved From 'Devil-Worshipping' - The Messenger
text: [Mother of Family Found Dead in 27-Room Boston Mansion Was CEO, on Board of Red Cross Charity](/news/mother-family-murder-suicide-boston-mansion-ceo-red-cross-teena-kamal?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Lil Nas X Trolls Critics With Website About Being Saved From ‘Devil-Worshipping’ Lil Nas X has recently teased fans that he plans to release Christian music after his 2021 'Montero' music video saw him riding a pole to Hell and giving Satan a lap dance [Glenn Garner](/author/glenn-garner) Lil Nas X is putting on the theatrics once again as he teases his upcoming sophomore album and a new creative era. The Grammy Award winner has released SaveNasX.com , a very '90s-style website promoting his new work that features a clock counting the time since his debut studio album Montero dropped in 2021. "LIL NAS X hasn't released an album in over two years," reads a blurb on the page. "This site is dedicated to finding him and saving him by turning his heart toward Christ's light!" It further reads, "Has the DEVIL-WORSHIPPING pop-artist finally been sacrificed to HIS MASTER? WHY is he SECLUDING HIMSELF???? What is he PREPARING FOR? This site will answer ALL THESE QUESTIONS AND MORE!!!... We will find Montero, and WE WILL SAVE HIM BY RETURNING HIS HEART TO J.CHRIST'S LIGHT " Lil Nas X's latest publicity stunt comes after he made waves with his 2021 music video for " Montero (Call Me By Your Name) ," which saw him riding a pole down to Hell and giving Satan a lap dance. The "Industry Baby" artist has since teased fans that he plans to release Christian music next. "Y'all mind if I enter my Christian era?" he wrote last month, sharing a taste of a potential new spiritual song. author: Michael Copley
title: A warm, dry spring has U.S. forecasters worried about the upcoming wildfire season | KGOU
text: A warm, dry spring has U.S. forecasters worried about the upcoming wildfire season Most of the United States is expected to see warmer-than-average temperatures this spring, federal forecasters say, with dry conditions likely in the West. That's raising concerns about wildfires, especially in parts of the Southwest, Great Plains, and the Upper Mississippi River Valley, said Jon Gottschalck, operations branch chief at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Climate Prediction Center. The southern High Plains, in particular, which includes Colorado, Kansas, New Mexico, Oklahoma, and Texas, is going to be "quite vulnerable to high wildfire risk, especially during high wind events," Gottschalck said Thursday on a call with reporters. Texas recently suffered the largest wildfire in the state's history, which investigators [say was started by power lines](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/07/us/texas-smokehouse-creek-fire-xcel-energy.html). In the Mid-Atlantic this week, high winds [helped fuel blazes](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/21/us/virginia-wv-wildfires.html) in North Carolina, Virginia, West Virginia, and Maryland. NOAA [released its Spring Outlook](https://www.noaa.gov/news-release/spring-outlook-warmer-for-most-of-us-wetter-in-southeast) amid a stretch of record warm weather. Last month was the [hottest February on record](https://www.noaa.gov/news/earth-just-had-its-warmest-february-on-record), and 2023 was the [hottest year ever](https://www.npr.org/2023/12/28/1221827923/2023-hottest-year-record-climate-change). High average temperatures last year were exacerbated by a strong El Niño climate pattern, which is a [natural cycle](https://www.npr.org/2023/07/05/1186098964/with-el-nino-and-climate-change-this-week-saw-some-of-the-hottest-recorded-weath) that heats water in the Pacific Ocean and raises average temperatures worldwide. Gottschalck said the effects of the current El Niño are expected to weaken through the spring. But recent heat records are part of a longer warming trend that scientists expect to continue as climate change intensifies. Global temperatures are rising because of the accumulation of greenhouse gasses like carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, [according to the World Meteorological Organization](https://wmo.int/news/media-centre/climate-change-indicators-reached-record-levels-2023-wmo#:~:text=The%20WMO%20report%20confirmed%20that,ten%2Dyear%20period%20on%20record.), which is part of the United Nations. Those greenhouse gasses come from humans burning fossil fuels. "Climate change is affecting the timing, intensity, and duration of weather events in the United States," Rick Spinrad, NOAA's administrator, said in a news release. Forecasters also warned of low water levels on the Mississippi River this summer because of below-average snowpack and precipitation in the Northern Plains and the Midwest. Ed Clark, director of the National Water Center, said low-flow conditions could affect navigation on the entire Mississippi River system, as well as water supplies for communities and industries. NOAA doesn't expect major flooding anywhere in the country this spring. Copyright 2024 NPR. To see more, visit https://www.npr.org.

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Win a Luxury BYD ATTO 3 in the Pin to Win Competition: A Leap Towards Sustainable Driving
text:
In an electrifying blend of competition and innovation, Sunrise host Nat Barr recently took the BYD ATTO 3 electric vehicle for a spin, as part of the highly anticipated Pin to Win competition. This contest, a partnership with Earth Fare, offers participants the chance to win a luxury car valued at over $50,000. The competition is drawing attention not just for its grand prize, but also for showcasing the capabilities and appeal of electric vehicles (EVs) in Australia’s automotive landscape.
A Glimpse into the Future of Mobility
The BYD ATTO 3, a symbol of modern engineering and environmental consciousness, has garnered widespread acclaim, quickly becoming one of Australia's best-selling electric vehicles. Within just a year of its introduction, it has not only captured the imagination of eco-friendly drivers but also marked a significant milestone in the electric vehicle industry. The model tested by Barr, known for its soft yet firm front seats, massive sunroof, and easy charging capabilities, represents a leap towards sustainable driving solutions. Barr, a mother-of-two, expressed her admiration for the vehicle's design, particularly praising its availability in blush pink, a color that adds a touch of personality to the eco-friendly vehicle.
Rising Star in the Auto Industry
The rise of BYD as a powerhouse in the automotive sector is a story of ambition and strategic foresight. Recently outpacing Volkswagen as China’s leading car brand, BYD recorded a staggering 43% increase in sales during the first quarter of 2023. This growth is not just a testament to the company's innovative electric vehicles but also underscores its commitment to environmental sustainability and ethical practices. BYD’s dedication to corporate social responsibility, including stringent labor practices, human rights, and environmental considerations, sets a benchmark for the industry.
Driving Toward a Greener Tomorrow
As the Pin to Win competition unfolds, it offers more than just a chance to win a luxury electric vehicle; it serves as a platform to highlight the advancements in EV technology and the shift towards more sustainable modes of transportation. The competition, accessible through 7news.com, invites Australians to envision a greener, cleaner future. By participating, individuals not only get a shot at winning the BYD ATTO 3 but also contribute to the broader dialogue about environmental responsibility and innovation in the automotive industry.
In conclusion, the Pin to Win competition, featuring the BYD ATTO 3 electric vehicle, is more than just a contest; it's a showcase of the future of driving. With Nat Barr's firsthand experience highlighting the vehicle's superior design and performance, and the competition stirring up excitement and engagement, the event marks a significant moment in Australia's journey towards embracing electric vehicles. As the deadline approaches, participants are encouraged to enter for a chance to make a bold statement about sustainability while possibly winning a car that represents the pinnacle of modern automotive technology.

author: Naomi Chima
title: How giving God N5,000 brought me N25,000, foodstuff— Pastor Ibiyeomie
text: The presiding pastor of Salvation Ministries, David Ibiyeomie, has said that giving God his salary of N5000 in 1997 led to a chain of miracles.

author: ACN
title: Incendi de Sant Pere Sallavinera: Controlat el foc, que ha afectat 130 hectàrees de superfície agrícola i forestal
text:
Controlat l'incendi de Sant Pere Sallavinera, que ha afectat 130 hectàrees
Els Agents Rurals treballen amb la hipòtesi que el foc es va originar pels treballs d'una màquina de segar
Bombers treballant a l'incendi de Sant Pere Sallavinera / Oscar Bayona
ACN
Els Bombers de la Generalitat han donat per controlat a dos quarts de deu de la nit d'aquest dimecres l'incendi que es va declarar aquest dimarts a la tarda a Sant Pere Sallavinera i que ha afectat 130 hectàrees de superfície agrícola i forestal. El foc està estabilitzat des d'ahir, i s'ha treballat des d'aleshores per aconseguir arribar a la fase de control. Avui s'ha estès el sistema de línies d'aigua per poder-ho rematar bé i s'ha trobat una gran quantitat de biomassa. Ha calgut fer maniobres d'obertura de caixa amb eines manuals per accedir a les zones més frondoses. Durant el dia hi han treballat 28 dotacions i un centenar d'efectius, però aquesta nit es preveu reduir notablement l'operatiu.
Veïns de la Llavinera: "Sembla que el vent bufa cap a una altra banda, però no estem gens tranquils"
ACN
Sobre l'origen del foc, el cos d'Agents Rurals treballa amb la hipòtesi que el foc es va originar durant les tasques de recol·lecció del cereal. Així ho explicava aquest migdia el cap de l'àrea regional de la Catalunya Central dels Agents Rurals, Jordi Carrasco, que detallava que durant les tasques d'investigació que van fer dimarts van determinar que l'àrea d'inici del foc se situava en un camp de cereals. "Vam trobar una màquina que havia estat treballant i que accidentalment va originar l'incendi", assegura.
El foc va obligar a confinar ahir masies disseminades de tres municipis de la zona de l'incendi durant unes hores, fins que es va aconseguir estabilitzar el foc i es van poder aixecar les mesures restrictives.

author: /cronologia/-/meta/redaccion
title: En alerta amarilla Omoa y Puerto Cortés; cuatro departamentos están en verde
text:
Cortés, Honduras.- Ante las fuertes lluvias que están ocasionando crecidas de ríos, inundaciones y otros daños, la Secretaría de Estado en los Despachos de Gestión de Riesgos y Contingencias Nacionales (Copeco) ha emitido una alerta amarilla para los municipios de Omoa y Puerto Cortés, en el departamento de Cortés.
Atlántida, Colón e Islas de la Bahía y de igual manera para el resto de Cortés, se mantiene en alerta verde por un período de 48 horas a partir de las 11:00 p.m. del jueves 12 de diciembre.
El Centro de Estudios Atmosféricos, Oceanográficos y Sísmicos (Cenaos), explicó que estas lluvias son debido a la influencia de una cuña débil de alta presión que ingresó al territorio hondureño.
Este fenómeno está generando nubosidad abundante, lluvias y chubascos débiles a moderados con posibles tormentas eléctricas en el norte y noroccidente del país.
Asimismo, se pronostican temperaturas frescas y vientos del noreste.
El oleaje en el litoral Caribe se mantendrá alterado, con olas de entre 3 y 5 pies, mientras que el oriente del país experimentará precipitaciones débiles.
Recomendaciones
A las autoridades municipales se les solicita mantener una vigilancia constante sobre cualquier amenaza que pueda afectar a la población, especialmente en zonas vulnerables.
Pobladores que viven en las zonas cercanas a ríos y áreas propensas a deslizamientos y otros riesgos se les recomienda no cruzar vados, ríos ni quebradas crecidas, y tomar medidas de prevención.
De igual manera, se recomienda continuar con el aseguramiento de techos y la limpieza de cunetas, tragantes y desagües para evitar inundaciones urbanas repentinas.

author: @infobae
title: El Ayuntamiento de París asegura que el río Sena es "apto para nadar" - Infobae
text: El Ayuntamiento de París, a través de su teniente de alcalde Pierre Rabadan, ha asegurado este jueves que el Sena es "apto para nadar" y ha tranquilizado así a entrenadores y deportistas sobre las condiciones sanitarias y la contaminación del río, a menos de un mes para que empiecen los Juegos Olímpicos en la capital francesa. Así lo constató el medio de comunicación francés RMC Sport. Aplazado por el contexto de las elecciones legislativas y también por la dudosa calidad del agua, el baño de la alcaldesa parisina Anne Hidalgo en el Sena "aún podría celebrarse antes del inicio" de esos JJ.OO., cuya ceremonia inaugural está programada para el 26 de julio. Según Rabadan, exjugador de rugby y actual teniente de alcalde y máximo responsable de Deportes en el Ayuntamiento, será posible nadar en el Sena pese a los recientes temores sobre el grado de contaminación por la bacteria Escherichia coli. "Los resultados de los últimos días son satisfactorios y coherentes con la natación", afirmó al respecto. "Sabíamos por qué no se debía a las fuertes lluvias que tuvimos en mayo y junio. Ahora los resultados de la calidad del agua son consistentes con nuestras necesidades", añadió Rabadan, quien dijo que las competiciones de natación en aguas abiertas y de triatlón podrán desarrollarse según lo previsto por los organizadores de los JJ.OO. "Obviamente, los próximos días deben continuar en esta dirección, pero no tengo preocupaciones", comentó el teniente de alcalde parisino durante un evento en la Plaza de la Concordia. Antes de concluir, Rabadan hizo una promesa clara: "Estaremos ahí para los JJ.OO.".

author: John Eric Mendoza
title: 7.4 million joins pilgrimage in Antipolo
text:
Pilgrims flock to Antipolo Cathedral on Maundy Thursday, March 28, 2024, in observance of a Holy Week tradition. (Photo from the Antipolo Cathedral’s facebook page)
MANILA, Philippines — Some 7.4 million pilgrims joined the “Alay Lakad” or the religious pilgrimage to Antipolo Cathedral on Maundy Thursday, which is more than a million bigger than last year’s total.
These pilgrims took part on the long uphill walk to the Cathedral with the belief that they are sharing in Jesus’ suffering during his Passion.
ADVERTISEMENT READ: Around 760,000 join Good Friday procession of Black Nazarene
FEATURED STORIES NEWSINFO Senate bill for new pay hikes, addt’l benefits for gov’t employees filed NEWSINFO Hackers break into Coast Guard’s Facebook page anew NEWSINFO Pampanga ‘Kristo’ crucified for 35th time on Good Friday “This pilgrimage serves as a sign to express their steadfast faith and devotion while following the footsteps of the Lord,” the Quiapo Cathedral said in a Facebook post in Filipino.
The Antipolo church management said the celebration had been peaceful and orderly.
In 2023, around six million pilgrims went to Antipolo Cathedral after being suspended for two years due to COVID-19 pandemic.
READ: Group urges Antipolo pilgrimage participants to avoid littering
Part of the Holy Week celebrations, Alay Lakad is a mixture of two Filipino words “alay” which means ‘offering’, and “lakad” or “to walk.”
Holy Week is the most solemn period in the Catholic Church’s liturgical calendar when Christians commemorate the suffering, death, and resurrection of Christ over 2,000 years ago.
